DataElement.preferredName: Diagnosis Disease or Disorder ICD-10-CM Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The diagnosis, in humans, as captured in the 2022 extension of the tenth version of the International Classification of Disease (ICD-10-CM, the disease code subset of ICD-10).  Examples - C80.1, C44.510, D14.3-, D49.89.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.:Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms.

Concepts.definition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

Property.preferredDefinition: A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The 2022 extension of the ICD-10 created by the U.S. National Center for Health Statistics so that the system could be used to capture more morbidity data. This extension included a section of procedure codes._A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An extension of the ICD-10 created by the U.S. National Center for Health Statistics so that the system could be used to capture more morbidity data. This extension included a section of procedure codes.

Concepts.longName: International Classification of Diseases, Tenth Revision, Clinical Modification
Concepts.definition: An extension of the ICD-10 created by the U.S. National Center for Health Statistics so that the system could be used to capture more morbidity data. This extension included a section of procedure codes.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRDC Instruction
ReferenceDocuments.description:
1. Go to https://www.cdc.gov/nchs/icd/Comprehensive-Listing-of-ICD-10-CM-Files.htm
2. Scroll down to the '2022 release of ICD-10-CM section''.
3. Download the appropriate file.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRDC SDO Reference 2
ReferenceDocuments.description:
Format and Structure of ICD-O-10 codes from FY2022 April1 update ICD-10-CM Guidelines:

The ICD-10-CM Tabular List contains categories, subcategories and codes. Characters for categories, subcategories and codes may be either a letter or a number. All categories are 3 characters. A three-character category that has no further subdivision is equivalent to a code. Subcategories are either 4 or 5 characters. Codes may be 3, 4, 5, 6 or 7 characters. That is, each level of subdivision after a category is a subcategory. The final level of subdivision is a code. Codes that have applicable 7th characters are still referred to as codes, not subcategories. A code that has an applicable 7th character is considered invalid without the 7th character.

The ICD-10-CM uses an indented format for ease in reference.
